alert.note: Alert for Adair; Clinton; Cumberland; Metcalfe; Monroe; Russell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 7:26PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clinton, southeastern Monroe, Russell, Cumberland, southwestern Adair and southeastern Metcalfe Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 626 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Columbia to 7 miles southeast of Tompkinsville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jamestown and Albany. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Clinton; Cumberland; Metcalfe; Monroe; Russell
